talent.name: Talent Magic
talent.description: Everyone is born with exactly one unique magical talent
talent.lore:
In these realms, magic is personal. Every person is born with exactly one
magical talent, never to be repeated. Some talents are grand, some are humble,
but each is unique. The hierarchy of talents (mundane, minor, moderate, major,
Magician-class) determines much of social standing.

sources.name: Innate Talent
sources.description: The talent you were born with - unique to you alone

laws.name: The One Talent Law
laws.description: Each person has exactly one talent. No more, no less. Ever.

laws.name: Talent Uniqueness
laws.description: No two people in the universe share the same talent

laws.name: Birth Determination
laws.description: Talents are determined at birth and cannot be chosen or changed

risks.description: Overusing your talent can tire you out

acquisitionMethods.description: Born with a unique magical talent

narrative.name: Narrative Causality
narrative.description: Story logic and genre conventions are laws of nature
narrative.lore:
On the Disc, stories are things. Narrative causality shapes events to
match the stories that want to be told. The million-to-one chance works
because stories say it should. Heroes survive because the story needs them.
Some rare individuals learn to sense and manipulate these narrative threads.

sources.name: Narrative Weight
sources.description: The power of being in a story

laws.name: Narrative Imperative
laws.description: Stories want to be told certain ways. Fighting the narrative is exhausting.

laws.name: Genre Conventions
laws.description: Different genres have different rules. Know which story you're in.

laws.name: Lampshade Principle
laws.description: Acknowledging a narrative convention weakens its power

risks.description: Fighting the narrative too hard causes reality glitches
Being too narratively significant attracts plot complications

acquisitionMethods.description: Becoming aware of the story you're in
Studying enough stories to recognize the patterns

pun.name: Pun Magic
pun.description: Words have literal magical power based on their sounds
pun.lore:
In the land of Xanth, puns are not merely wordplay but fundamental forces
of nature. A "shoe tree" grows shoes. A "door mat" makes doors very formal.
The groaner the pun, the more powerful the magic. Newcomers often groan
at the omnipresent wordplay, but natives have learned to appreciate - or at
least tolerate - the punny nature of their reality.

laws.name: Literal Truth
laws.description: Words mean exactly what they sound like they mean

laws.name: Groan Power
laws.description: The worse the pun, the more powerful the magic

risks.description: Too many puns cause reality to punish you with worse puns

wild.name: Wild Magic
wild.description: Chaotic magic that does unpredictable things
wild.lore:
In places where the fabric of reality is thin, magic runs wild. Spells
don't do what they're supposed to. Random effects cascade. Colors taste
like sounds. Wild mages learn to ride the chaos rather than control it,
surfing the waves of probability and hoping for the best.

laws.name: Uncontrollable
laws.description: Attempting precise control invites worse chaos

risks.description: Major failures cause permanent random changes

acquisitionMethods.description: Caught wild magic like a disease
